page.title: 06COSFORD AEROSPACE MUSEUM
page.content: Cosford museum is part of a family of R.A.F. museums,3 at Hendon and the 4th at Cosford. It has been open to the public since 1979 on a full time basis only being open on Sundays prior to this.Last year from April to October they had 60,000 visitors.On the last Whit weekend they had 11,000 visitors. It has some 70 aircraft on display as well as missiles,engines and uniforms from the 2nd World War Korean War and Falklands conflict.They specialize in transport aircaft and the history of British Airways.The museum covers approx 120 acres.The last civilian plane they had fly to Cosford was the Bristol Brittania and the last R.A.F. plane was a V-bomber used during the Falklands War. They have 3 fulltime employees and 17 Y.T.S.workers.In the Summer most staff are part-time and many voluntary
